summary_points: 1. Lynn Elsenhans, a Baker Hughes board member since 2019, will not stand for re-election at the 2025 Annual Meeting; her departure is not due to any disagreement with the company.
2. The Baker Hughes board will expand from ten to eleven members, effective May 1, 2025, with the election of Ilham Kadri.
3. Ilham Kadri's compensation will be consistent with other non-employee directors, as previously disclosed in the company's March 31, 2025 Proxy Statement.
1. Gregory S. Lovins returned as Avery Dennison's Chief Financial Officer on April 1, 2025, after a medical leave of absence, with an approved base salary of $838,500.
2.  Danny G. Allouche ceased serving as Interim Chief Financial Officer on March 31, 2025, but will remain Senior Vice President and Chief Strategy and Corporate Development Officer.

3. Mr. Lovins' previous incentive plan opportunities (75% of base salary for Annual Incentive Plan and 250% of base salary for long-term incentives) remained unchanged following the annual executive compensation review in February 2025.
1. AIG authorized a $7.5 billion common stock repurchase program as of March 31, 2025.
2. AIG projects a 20%+ Compound Annual Growth Rate (CAGR) in operating earnings per share from 2025-2027, driven partly by generative AI.
3.  The SEC filing contains numerous additional graphics, suggesting a substantial amount of supplementary visual data.
1. On March 31, 2025, EQT Corp completed exchange offers and consent solicitations for EQM Midstream Partners, LP notes, resulting in $3,869,493,000 in Existing EQM Notes being validly tendered.
2.  The percentage of outstanding notes tendered varied significantly by series, ranging from 38.1% (5.500% Senior Notes due 2028) to 99.5% (6.375% Senior Notes due 2029).

3. Settlement of the exchange offers and consent solicitations is expected to occur on April 2, 2025, resulting in the elimination of substantially all restrictive covenants from the Existing EQM Indentures, except for the 5.500% Senior Notes due 2028.
